Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, fabric is red/brown/black in section, interior spotted with a black resinous deposit, with remains of at least six lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, worn in places, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.90-91)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87593) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87593)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 94 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
